schemeName: Junior Research Fellowship in Science, Humanities and Social Sciences
objective: To provide Financial assistance to NET/JRF-qualified candidates to undertake advanced studies and research leading to M. Phil. / Ph. D. Degree in Humanities and Social Sciences including Languages and Sciences.
eligibility: Candidates who have qualified in NET-JRF or the UGC-CSIR joint test. However, the registration for the M.Phil/PhD is made by the Universities/Institutions/Colleges within stipulated period of two years from the date of declaration of result or date of issue of award letter/date of joining the fellowship.
tenure: 5 years or submission of thesis whichever is earlier

schemeName: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
objective: To provide fellowship for pursuing research work leading to award of Ph.D. degree.
To support higher education of single girl child in Social Sciences.
To recognize the value of observance of small family norm.
To promote the concept of single girl child in society.
To empower and promote single girl children through higher education.
eligibility: Any single girl child of her parents pursuing Ph.D. in any stream/subject in recognised Universities/Colleges/ Institutes is eligible to apply under the scheme.
slots: The number of slots for fellowship will be decided every year on the basis of eligible applications complete in all respects, received through online mode.
tenure: Fellowship will be granted upto the date of submission of Ph.D. Thesis or 5 years of tenure whichever is earlier.

salary: Rs. 10,000/- pa for initial two years
Rs. 10,000/- pa for initial two years

schemeName: IshanUday Special Scholarship Scheme for North Eastern Region
objective: To promote higher education in the North Eastern Region by providing financial assistance to the students of the region.
eligibility: The scholarship is open to students who have passed Class XII or equivalent examination from a school situated within the North Eastern Region (NER) through a recognized Board of Education. Only students admitted in the first year of UG degree programme through Regular/Full Time mode are eligible. The scholarship is applicable only for recognized UG degree programmes notified by UGC from time to time. In case of integrated or dual degree programmes, the scholarship is payable for the UG component only. The annual income of the parents should be below Rs. 4.50 lakh.

schemeName: National Scholarship for Post Graduate Studies
objective: To provide financial assistance to Indian students leading to award of Postgraduate Degree.
eligibility: Students admitted in the first year of PG degree programme through Regular/Full Time mode in an eligible university/college/institution are eligible to apply. In case of integrated programmes, the scholarship shall be provided for the PG component only. The age limit for applicants is 30 years. The scholarship is applicable only to students pursuing recognized PG degree programmes leading to specified PG degrees notified by UGC from time to time, as per UGC Notification on Specification of Degrees, 2014 and amendments thereof.
